User: [EXPLANATION] Tell me about 41-116 4111510 replacing cover for left or right
Assistant: 41-116

4111510 REPLACING COVER FOR LEFT OR RIGHT SIDE MEMBER
(REAR SIDE PANEL REMOVED)
TWO DOOR MODEL -

Remove brazing solder. Pull out cover underneath front door pillar. Refer to information on page 41 - 001

Remove or disconnect following parts:

ground lead on battery, rear bumper, left tail light assembly, trunk mats, wall trim,
left wheel house trim, tail panel trim, trunk lid seal, rear window complete with
rubber frame, side window, rear seat cushion and backrest, front seat, side trim
Panel, hatrack, entrance cover strip, front door pillar carpet, passenger compartment
carpets partially, roof liner partially, seat belt, door pillar trim, front door seals, door
striker, C pillar air extraction mask, rear side panel rubbing strip, left wheel house
Cover, fuel tank complete, brace on floor assembly and wire harness in trunk

per

Straighten and grind mating surfaces. Coat mating surfaces needed for spot welding
with zine dust paint,

17730 41586

SMBH Remove side panel — see 41 35 101 4 Grind mating surfaces on new cover.

Assistant: 4111043/ REPLACING LEFT/RIGHT ENGINE CARRIER FRONT SECTION WITHOUT
044 WHEEL HOUSE

Refer to information on page 41 - 001. Remove or disconnect following parts. Disconnect battery ground lead,

User: [EXPLANATION] Tell me about 23-112 push or drive on output flange
Assistant: 23-112

Push or drive on output flange. Install collar nut with locking compound**
Apply Special Tool 23 1 200. Hold output flange with Special Too. Tighten collar nut with Special Too.

User: [EXPLANATION] Can you describe 41-10 c install tail panel?
Assistant: 41-10 C

Install tail panel. Seal off all mating surfaces from top and
bottom with a body sealing compound. ‘Spray an anti-drumming compound on
bottom of car, wheel houses and tail panel
from underneath.

User: [PROCEDURE] What are the steps to 1711509 flushing radiator if oil has penetrated into the coolant circuit, the radiator and expansion?
Assistant: 1. Pour in 2 to 3 liters (4 to 6 pints) of Solvethane.
2. Shake radiator and tank thoroughly and drain after oil has been dissolved (2 to 3 utes).
3. Fill entire cooling system with hot water and flush thoroughly by replacing hot ater several times to guarantee removal of solvethane residue.
4. Check drained coolant for traces of oil and repeat test step 5 (if necessary).
